text:
I think it would be very useful to be able to specify a log file where
stderr and stdout would be stored. This is now possible by redirecting
these streams externally when starting Tomcat but it would be much more
useful if it was integrated with the already present logging features
of Tomcat.
The benefits would be, IMHO, quite important especially during the
production phase, as these logs are very important when debugging 
applications. Rotating them would also be very important and as this
feature would be incorporated in future enhancements of the Tomcat logging
system, it will will be incorporated without much effort.
The proposed sytax for the configuration file would be very similar to the 
already present logging facilities. Extracted from a Ignacio J. Ortega
proposal, it would be something like...
<Logger name="System.out"
        path="logs/out.log"
        verbosityLevel = "DEBUG" />
<Logger name="System.err"
        path="logs/out.log"
        verbosityLevel = "DEBUG" />
The implementation shouldn't be very difficult, as redirecting these streams can 
be done very easily through the calls System.setErr and System.setOut.
As this is a RFE and affects all platforms, I don't include any reference to 
operating systems...

text: Won't be addressed for Tomcat 3.2.2 but will be evaluated for later releases.

Regardless of this option, the original stderr and stdout should still go somewhere, so we cannot get rid of those streams being redirected externally by whatever runs Tomcat.

In current versions of Tomcat there is "swallowOutput" option on Context [1], that will cause stderr and stdout of a webapp being caught and redirected to the proper logging subsystem -- for those webapps that are still using System.err and System.out.

[1] http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/config/context.html

The <Logger> element is no longer used in the configuration.

I am changing resolution of this issue from "RESOLVED LATER" to "RESOLVED WONTFIX".
